desc: List of common memes/acronyms used all over the chat/internet

SEN.title: The Stack Exchange Network, the network that houses all the sites on Stack Exchange.

SEDE.title: The Stack Exchange Data Explorer, an integrated SQL client equipped with access to site data and graphing tools. Resets StackSundays.

StackDay.title: When the time strikes UTC midnight, the rep cap, votes, flags and stars reset. A "new" StackDay is defined as UTC midnight. So, Stack(Afternoon, Night, Morning) are just the times in UTC.

SNR.title: Sonic to Noise Ratio: Determines the ratio of crap-to-quality.

Winter Bash.title: An event that occured during the winter of '14, where users far and wide had all kinds of silly hats.

Area 51.title: Stack Exchange's new-site-makerer, responsible for housing requests for new sites.

waiting for design.title: Before a beta site can "truly" graduate, they need to receive their site design from SE.

Unicorns.title: Unicorns are the magically weaponized form of a pony.

Jon Skeet.title: The top user on Stack Overflow, who can rep cap every day without needing to visit.

Needs more jQuery.title: When your implementation simply needs more jQuery to be better.

6 to 8 weeks.title: The time estimate given "off the top of my head" when the Stack Exchange team has only a vague idea of how long a task will take because they have little-to-no formal scheduling or even a list of tasks.

Burninated.title: Used in reference to deleting a tag from the system.

Caching.title: Don't treat this text as true, caching is to blame.

Swag.title: Stack Exchange/Overflow related merchandise, formerly available on the SO shop, now limited to events and high-rep users.
